com.esri.mo2.client.io
Interface Esrimap

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseEsrimap
public interface Esrimap

This interface allows a client-side object to access any ESRIMAP server-side object.

The three types of ESRIMAP server-side objects supported are,

  • ArcIMS version 3.x servlet ESRIMAP
  • IMS version 2.0/1.0 ISAPI (MS Web server) ESRIMAP
  • IMS version 2.0/1.0 NSAPI (Netscape Web server) ESRIMAP

          Basic authentication.

          Identifies a Microsoft Web server
static int NETSCAPE_SERVER
          Identifies a Netscape Web server

Method Detail

getURL

public URL getURL()
Returns the URL for the remote ESRIMAP object. This depends on how the implementing class was constructed.

See Also:
BaseEsrimap

ping

public boolean ping()
This method attempts to "ping" ESRIMAP on the remote server.

Returns:
a boolean variable - True, if ping is successful, else False
See Also:
BaseEsrimap

getServer

public int getServer()
Returns the server type as detected by the most recent successful ping.

Returns:
an identifier for one of the supported Web servers [0 - Java Web server, 1 - Microsoft Web server, 2 - Netscape Web server]

getServerName

public String getServerName()
Returns the server name corresponding with a Web server type (Java/Netscape/Microsoft).

Returns:
a server name for one of the supported web server types

getVersion

public String getVersion()
Returns a brief ESRIMAP version information as detected by the most recent successful ping.

Returns:
a brief ESRIMAP version information

getFullVersion

public String getFullVersion()
Returns the complete ESRIMAP version information of the most recent successful ping.

Returns:
the full ESRIMAP version information

setUserCredentials

public void setUserCredentials(String username,
                               String password)
Sets the username and password that is used by the middleware during authentication.

Parameters:
username - the login user name
password - the login password

getUsername

public String getUsername()
Returns the username (set earlier) to be used for middleware authentication.

Returns:
the username

getPassword

public String getPassword()
Returns the password (set earlier) to be used for middleware authentication.

Returns:
the password

setAuthType

public void setAuthType(String authType)
Sets the authentication type to be used.

Parameters:
authType - the authentication type - Basic or Digest

getAuthType

public String getAuthType()
Returns the authentication type(Basic or Digest) if already determined.

The authentication type could be known either from a previous response from middleware or by explicitly setting the value in the setAuthType method in a previous call.

Returns:
the type of authentication (Basic or Digest)
